lexUnit.name: offend.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause the feeling of offense

sentence.text: Even though Mr. Darcy is deeply offended by Elizabeth 's low rank in society and that of her family 's behaviour , especially Mrs. Bennet and her younger daughters , Darcy still proposes to Elizabeth .
Turnouts in Guardian elections were extremely low ( perhaps 10-15% of registered electors ) and Guardians who offended influential ratepayers were easily ousted .
He unnerves and often offends colleagues on the Legislative Council , many of whom believe their institution is safer in the hands of appointees and amateurs than of populists .
Lear is offended by Oswald 's negligence ( I.iv.47ff. ) , and his new servant ( Kent , returned in disguise ) shows his loyalty by tripping up this ` clotpoll " .
But the I offended the schoolmaster very much not sitting this exam because erm his record depended upon how many pupils he could get to pass this exam .
If , on the other hand , she is offended by the attitude of the shop assistants , she wo n't come back again .
But I have to admit that in the past I have been offended by people saying that it 's just formula for me to play melodies and structures that come to me very naturally .
They are offended by his tentative steps towards recognising a role for the Pope even outside the Church of England .
Ingmar was truly offended by Digby 's stupidity .
` I understand your feelings , Li Yuan , " Tsu Ma answered him , smiling at the old T'ang to show he was not offended by his son 's interruption .
The women though were more offended at the attitude of the Council .
He felt very sorry he had offended her so much by telling her he had seen her when she thought she was alone .
Clearly the Government decided to tread carefully so as not to offend the judiciary by appearing to interfere directly with their discretionary powers to sentence as they think appropriate .
He was n't just mortally offended .
Then , very stiffly , ` I am afraid I offended you . "
However , I do not want to offend my local church organist by asking her to step down .
` I am so sorry if I 've offended you . "
I was so offended I asked him to leave me alone .
